snippet: The deal, announced on Wednesday, will pay Fleetwood Mac when the band’s songs are played on the radio and on the Internet.
abstract: Radio station company Clear Channel strikes first-of-its-kind revenue-sharing deal with Fleetwood Mac, in which the company will pay the band when its songs are played on the radio and the Internet.
lead_paragraph: The deal, announced on Wednesday, will pay Fleetwood Mac when the band’s songs are played on the radio and on the Internet.

headline.main: Clear Channel Makes Revenue-Sharing Deal With Fleetwood Mac
headline.print_headline: Clear Channel in Deal With Fleetwood Mac
